Package ec.co.ant

Class AntSpecies

java.lang.Object
ec.Species
ec.co.ant.AntSpecies
All Implemented Interfaces:
Prototype, Setup, Serializable, Cloneable
public class AntSpecies extends Species
Coordinates the core behavior of Ant Colony Optimization algorithms. There are many kinds of ACO algorithms, but many of them can be defined in terms of a PheromoneTable, a ConstructionRule (which reads pheromones to execute "ants"), and a local and/or global UpdateRule (which alter pheromone values in the environment).

AntSpecies species these components for an algorithm and coordinates their execution. ECJ's ACO algorithms are controlled by the usual EvolutionState characters, which hand off control to Species at appropriate points to generate solutions or perform pheromone updates.
Author:
Eric O. Scott
See Also:
  • ec.app.tsp
  • ec.app.knapsack

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup(EvolutionState state, Parameter base)
      Description copied from class: Species
      The default version of setup(...) loads requested pipelines and calls setup(...) on them and normalizes their probabilities. If your individual prototype might need to know special things about the species (like parameters stored in it), then when you override this setup method, you'll need to set those parameters BEFORE you call super.setup(...), because the setup(...) code in Species sets up the prototype.
      Specified by:
      setup in interface Prototype
      Specified by:
      setup in interface Setup
      Overrides:
      setup in class Species
      See Also:
      • Prototype.setup(EvolutionState,Parameter)

    • setupSuper

      private void setupSuper(EvolutionState state, Parameter base)
      A custom setup method for Species that skips the initialization of the breeding pipeline. We call this in place of super.setup(), since this Species doesn't use a pipeline.

    • updateSubpopulation

      public void updateSubpopulation(EvolutionState state, Subpopulation subpop)
      Apply a global update rule to the pheromone table.
      Overrides:
      updateSubpopulation in class Species
      Parameters:
      subpop - The Subpopulation to use as the input of the global update.

    • updateIndividual

      public void updateIndividual(EvolutionState state, Individual ind)
      Apply a local update rule to the pheromone table.

      Parameters:

      See Also:

    • newIndividual

      public ConstructiveIndividual newIndividual(EvolutionState state, int thread)
      Description copied from class: Species
      Provides a brand-new individual to fill in a population. The default form simply calls clone(), creates a fitness, sets evaluated to false, and sets the species. If you need to make a more custom genotype (as is the case for GPSpecies, which requires a light rather than deep clone), you will need to override this method as you see fit.
      Overrides:
      newIndividual in class Species

    • defaultBase

      public Parameter defaultBase()
      Description copied from interface: Prototype
      Returns the default base for this prototype. This should generally be implemented by building off of the static base() method on the DefaultsForm object for the prototype's package. This should be callable during setup(...).

    • repOK

      public final boolean repOK()
      Representation invariant, used for verification.
      Returns:
      true if the class is found to be in an erroneous state.
